Property.name: id
Property.Description: Contains the session id of the current session
Property.Help:
VARIABLE id - The session id of the current session.
DESCRIPTION The read-only ${id} variable contains the session id of the current session and primarily useful for including in the prompt.
SEE ALSO prompt, \sessions

Property.name: connected
Property.Description: Indicates whether or not the current session is connected
Property.Help:
VARIABLE connected - Indicates whether or not the current session is connected
DESCRIPTION The read-only ${connected} variable will contain the value "true" if the current session is connected to a server, otherwise "false". This is primarily useful for including in the prompt.
SEE ALSO prompt, \connect

Property.name: database
Property.Help:
VARIABLE database - Contains the connection's current database
DESCRIPTION The ${database} variable will contain the name of the database (or 'catalog' in JDBC terminology) of the current session if it connected to a server. In addition, the database context of the current connection can be changed by setting the ${database} variable to the desired database name.
SEE ALSO \connect, dflt_database

Property.name: autocommit
Property.Description: Contains the connection's current auto-commit status
Property.Help:
VARIABLE autocommit - Contains the connection's current auto-commit status
DESCRIPTION The ${autocommit} variable indicates whether or not the current connection is in auto-commit mode. In addition, the connections autocommit mode can be altered by setting this variable. To change the autocommit mode for all future connections, use the ${dflt_autocommit} variable.
SEE ALSO \connect, dflt_autocommit

Property.name: interactive
Property.Description: Whether or not the current session is interactive
Property.Help:
VARIABLE interactive - Indicates whether or not the current session is interactive
DESCRIPTION The read-only ${interactive} variable will contain "true" if the current session is interactive, or "false" otherwise.
